oh i'm watching dacin play this
that's how that works
there's a boss can't you see
invisible → ?
no, can't you see
it's obviously there
the boss is a block until it moves
the actual boss is what's hurting you there
as soon as it goes offscreen it goes into an idle state waiting for you to touch another trigger
right.... that would happen
i think you're expecting too much of the moon
yup
i don't think you're likely to see it again though... but we'll see
way more than 5 minutes
you'll see
why would anything funky happen with code i wrote

surely
i just wanted to write that dacin lmao
technically the yoshi has already looped
aaand there it is
nothing don't worry about it
yoshi going for a second loop.
huh
well i'll be
the boss checks for map16 tiles to handle it's movement, and I don't think it actually checks if it's in-bounds
so i'd have expected it to encounter a block that'd tell it to go somewhere and never come back
basically if it touches anything on map16 page 5 it'll set it's own y speed to the low byte
7f, yes
yeah, i suppose it mostly comes down to uninitialized ram
well, one more complication...
the code i wrote uses a screen table for indexing 7FC800, it doesn't calculate that value so it reads that table out of bounds
yes
depending on the code that comes after the table
the code after is called "PlaceMap16IfAtXEquals0"
X=0 referring to the camera
it's the part that warps you when you get the boss
no it's specifically the final one, those warps are handled by custom blocks
it's the reason why you don't get warped when you get the cloud jumps at the final boss
i never said it's not going right
well if you want to know it's getting the cloud jumps for the pipe achievement but then not going to the pipe
i don't expect anyone to find these moons, that's why they aren't tracked
they're just little easter eggs i put there because you can
okay fair
no no you are right
you're doing the thing of jumping too late again
gg thanks for playing, you have now seen everything this hack has to offer except for the intended solutions
oh this hack :)
time to see how quickly HF solves the puzzle.
i'll get ready to be upset
there might've been a puzzle I spend probably over 10h on that I fully expect you to do in less than 15m
i'll leave it at that until you beat it

oh that hint

A network socket is a software structure within a network node of a computer network that serves as an endpoint for sending and receiving data across the network. The structure and properties of a socket are defined by an application programming interface for the networking architecture. Sockets are created only during the lifetime of a process of an application running in the node.

anyway
he has all the stats

LUL
i was

but yeah so most of my issue lies with the fact that there isn't actually any hint saying that you should divide it into equal parts, sure you could infer that from it being a scale but then to me only 2 sets made sense, not 3
then the part saying "needs to be used, by any means" I don't agree that "I used it to put it away in my item box" is a good interpretation
and the last, rather minor thing but the part with "each jewel has it's own weight" to me is completely redundant, you already got the weights from the hidden chamber, you know that
right well to me "using it to open the chest" made a lot more sense
except that didn't work
but yeah, then there's also the fact that I'm just not good with numbers, I don't see 37 and see, "ah, 1 above something divisible by 3"
@TheBiob I will admit that the presentation is a bit mean. My design headspace for this hack was very inspired by how I play these sorts of games.
which is something you are very good at and why I fully expected you to solve it under 15m

@Fyre150 yeah, I mean i don't play this sort of puzzle often and again, I don't think the puzzle itself is bad by any means, my thought process just simply never aligned with what it was supposed to be which ended with me essentially having to look it up
which didn't feel satisfying, unsurprisingly
also another funfact about my playthrough: the scale puzzle was the first one I unlocked, and by very far the last one i solved of these
